content:
Have you completed the Optus troubleshooting steps https://www.optus.com.au/support/answer?id=2084

What were your results?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Have you checked your SMTP settings with those published by your Email provider on their website? What is the reason being given as to why a connection can't be made? btw, help is never offered on the basis of a donation.
creator: frisée

content:
Frisee, thanks for your reply

It is stating " sending of message failed The message could not be sent because connecting to outgoing server SMTP failed The server may be unavailalble or is resuing SMTP connections Please verify that your outgoing server SMTP settings are correct and try again"

I have done that multiple times with same result - I will try & find my Optusnet web mail provider page

What I meant by donations is that I am constantly being asked to donate to use the Thunderbird free email program (not to receive help) I am happy to donate but not while it is not working properly - this is not the first time this has happened and it is very frustrating

thanks for your suggestion - will look for that now........Elizabeth
creator: steveliz2

content: Is this a new installation? Has this suddenly happened? Down Detector is showing that there are connectivity problems with Optusnet in Australia at the current time. How long has this been continuing?
creator: frisée

content: Its not a new installation.. Been happening for about 4 days.. Had optus on the phone for 4 hours and couldn't resolve the issue. I can see my email on optus webmail so seems to be a send/receive issue between Optus server and Mozilla Thunderbolt. ???
creator: lukeoom

content:
Thunderbird doesn't have 'Customer Support'. It as open source and donation funded email program. The Community Forum is a group of people who come by and offer advice to people needing help. It's not a good idea to publicise your phone number as just about anyone could ring you and pretend to be someone they're not, even try to get money from you when they're not entitled to it.

The way forward is to post your problem and one of the contributors will, hopefully, respond to your query.
creator: frisée

content:
You could let your Email Provider know. Although they probably won't be able to do very much about it.

Spammers collect email addresses and then include them as the return address in the emails they send out. The body of the email contains the damaging links so the email address is completely superfluous except to try and legitimise it.

In the early days of the Internet, it used to happen to me a lot - but I changed address a few times and don't put my email address on public display for it to be retrieved and used.
creator: frisée
